ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great course, highly recommended. Undergraduates interested in pharmacology and drug discovery should definitely be encouraged to take this course. You will learn a lot of material from a great diversity of professors in the Pharmacology department. Exams are long (3 hours, and most people in the class didn't find this out until the day of the first exam), but very reasonable. One of my favorite courses at Yale thus far.

I would summarize it as a way to understand mechanism by which current therapies treat disease and areas/weaknesses to think about in the development of new drugs. I would recommend it to another student, particularly those interested in pursuing an industry position.
I would. But I'd say you have to be independent and expect little from the format of the class.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course deepened my understanding of variables and factors to consider during drug development.
